titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jesse Isidor Straus Autograph Collection, approximately 1727-1873
titlestmt.author: Inventory prepared by Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

publicationstmt.publisher: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Elizabeth Clarke August 2007

did.head: Collection Summary

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries

did.abstract: Letters, notes, receipts, dispatches, and some facsimile reproductions of documents pertaining to political and cultural events of the 18th and 19th centuries, including the French Revolution. Signers include Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI, Johann Gottfried Von Herder, Helmuth Graf von Moltke, Mozart, Jean Paul Richter, August Wilhelm von Schlegel, Johann Strauss, and Robert Walpole.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content Note
scopecontent.p: Letters, notes, receipts, dispatches, and some facsimile reproductions of documents pertaining to political and cultural events of the 18th and 19th centuries, including the French Revolution. Signers include Holy Roman Emperor Charles VI, Johann Gottfried Von Herder, Helmuth Graf von Moltke, Mozart, Jean Paul Richter, August Wilhelm von Schlegel, Johann Strauss, and Robert Walpole.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research according to the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use
userestrict.p: Permission to quote (publish) from unpublished or previously published material must be obtained as described in the regulations of the Vassar College Archives and Special Collections Library.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: The original listing was completed in 1942 or 1943. The list was presumably updated to include the 1945 accession. The last known update was a contents check and retyping of the list done in 2007.

custodhist.head: Custodial History
custodhist.p: The materials in this collection were gathered by Jessi Isidor Straus, the U.S. ambassador to France (1933-1936) and grandfather of Barbara Levy, VC 1942.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Barbara Levy donated the bulk of the material in 1939 when she was a freshman at Vassar. She gave a second smaller accession in January 1945 (marked with and asterisk in the container list). The gifts originally formed part of the Lucy Maynard Salmon Collection of Historical Materials.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jesse Isidor Straus Autograph Collection, Archives and Special Collections Library, Vassar College Libraries.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged by country. The items from the 1945 accession are marked with an asterisk (*).

did.unittitle: Anne, Duc de montmorency, 1493-1567 — Document dealing with landed estates,
Henry IV, King of France, 1553-1610 — Letter to the Count Palatine of the Rhine,
Turenne, Henri de la Tour d’Auvergne vicomte de, 1611-1675 — Letter to Cardinal Mazarin,
Moritz, Graaf von Sachsen, 1696-1750 (Saxe, Hermann-Maurice, comte de) — Document,
Malesherbes, Chrétien Guillaume de Lamoignon de 1721-1794 — Letter,
Augereau, Prince Françios Charles, duc de Castiglione, 1757-1816 — Letter, 8 Thermidor year II,
Barère de Vieuzac, Bertrand, 1755-1841 (other names on document) — Committee of Public Safety 17 Messidor of year II,
Barras, Paul François Jean Nicolas, 1755-1829 (other names on document not all identified) — Committee of General Security, 18 Brumaire Year III,
Beauharnais, Alexandre, 1760-1794 (other names on document not all identified) — National Assembly,
Cambacères, Jean Jacques Régis, duc de 1753-1824 (another name on document) — Committee of Public Safety, 21 Pluviôse Year III
Carnot, Lazare Nicoas Marguerite 1753-1823 (other names on document) — Committee of Public Safety, 5 Ventôse Year II,
Chaumette, Pierre Gaspard, 1763-1794 (in folder with Cambacères) — Commune of Paris, 13 Brumaire Year II
Collot d’Herbois, Jean Marie, 1750-1796 — See Barère and Carnot
Jourdan, Jean Baptiste, comte, 1762-1833 — Official military letter, 16 Thermidor Year II
Lindet, R. ? Two brothers with Robert as part of name Lindet, Jean Baptiste Robert, 1746-1825 Lindet, Robert Thomas, 1743-1823 See Barère and Carnot
Merlin de Douai, Philippe Antoine, 1754-1838 — See Cambacères
Mirabeau, Honoré Gabriel Vicot Riqueti, comte de, 1749-1791 — Letter,
Rouget de Lisle, Claude Joseph, 1760-1836 — Composition? And letter,
Tallien, Jean Lambert, 1767-1820 — Committee of Public Safety, 16 Florial Year III
Arrighi, Jean Toussaint, duc de Padoue, 1778-1853 — Letter,
Bernadotte, Jean Baptiste Jules, 1764-1844 (later Charles XIV of Sweden and Norway) a. Ministry of War, 8 Fructidor Year VII,
Bernadotte, Jean Baptiste Jules, 1764-1844 (later Charles XIV of Sweden and Norway) — b. Letter,
Berthier, Louis Alexandre, 1753-1815 — Ministry of war, 21 Prairial Year XI,
Bessières, Jean Baptiste, duc d’Istrie, 1766-1813 (Another signature on letter) — Letter,
Boissy d’Anglas, François Antoine, comte de, 1755-1826 — Letter,
Brune, Guillaume Marie Anne, 1763-1815 — Official notice,
Caffarelli (five brothers)? Louis M.J.M 1756-1799 C.A. 1758-1826 L.M.J. 1760-1845 J.B. 1763-1815 F.M.A. 1766-1849 — See Lannes
Davout, Louis Nicolas, duc d’Auerstaedt prince d’Eckműhl, 1770-1823 — Military document, ll Pluviôse Year X,
Duroc, Géraud Christophe Michel, duc de Frioul, 1772-1813 — a.See Bessières
Duroc, Géraud Christophe Michel, duc de Frioul, 1772-1813 — b. Letter,
Fouché, Joseph, duc d’Ortranto, 1759-1820 — Ministry of the General Police 5 Florial Year VIII,
Gouvion St. Cyr, Laurent, marquis de, 1764-1830 — Ministry of War,
Grouchy, Emmanuel, marquis de 1766-1847 — Ministry or war-receipt,
Junot, Andoche, duc d’Abrantes, 1771-1813 — Ministry of War-reciept,
Kellermann, François Christophe, duc de Valmy, 1735-1820 — Legion of Honor,
Lannes, Jean, duc de Montebello, prince de Siévers, 1769-1809 (several other names not all identified) — Financial record of consular guard, 7 Frimaire year IX,
Lefebvre, Francois Joseph, duc de Dantzig, 1755-1820 — Notice of military promotion, 13 Brumaire Year XIV,
Macdonald, Jacques Etienne Joseph Alexander, duc de Tarente, 1765-1840 — Royal Order of Legion of Honor,
Marmont, Auguste Frédéric Louis Viesse de, duc de Raguse, 1774-1852 — Royal and Military Order of St. Louis,
Masséna, André, duc de Rivoli, prince d’Essling, 1756-1817 — Ministry of war-receipt,
Moncey, Bon Adrien Jeannot de, duc de Conegliano, 1754-1842 — Official letter from office of the Imperial Guard,
Mortier, Edouard Adolphe Casimir Joseph,duc de Trévisee, 1768-1835 — Royal Order of the Legion of Honor,
Ney, Michel, duc d’Elchingen, 1769-1815 — Official military letter, 16 Prairial year X,
Oudinot, Nicolas Charles, duc de Reggio, 1767-1847 — Army of Italy, letter, 19 Messidor, year VIII,
Sérurier, Jean Mathieu Philibert, 1742-1819 (Another name not identified on document) — Letter,
Soult, Nicolas Jean de Dieu, duc de Dalmatie, 1769-1851 — Letter,
Stael-Holstein, Anne L.G. Necker, baronne de, 1766-1817 — Letter,
Suchet, Louis Gabriel, duc de D’Albufera, 1772-1826 — Letter,
Talleyrand-Périgord, Charles Maurice de, 1754-1838 — Ministry of Foreign Affairs, 9 Vendémiaire, Year VI,
Victor, Claude Victor Perrin dit, duc der Bellune, 1766-1841 — Letter,
Dumas, Alezandre (invitation connected with Dumas Père, but no evidence to prove whether the letter is Père or Fils) Père, 1803-1870 Fils, 1824-1895 — Two items: formal invitation, And a letter,
Pélissier, Aimable jean Jacques, duc de Malakof, 1794-1864 — Card with signature,
Uhrich, Jean Jacques Alexis, 1802-1886 — Army of Italy, Letter,
Letter from Napoleon III on embossed note of paper, dated Tuileries,
Alva, Fernando Alvarez de Toledo, 1508-1583 — Order,
Wallenstein, Albrecht Eusebius Wenzel von, Herzog von Friedland and Mecklenburg, 1583-1634 — Seal,
Marie Therese, 1717-1780 — Letter to the Bishop of Wurzburg and Bamberg,
Laudon or Loudon, Johann Ludwig Alexius, Freiherr von, 1762-1822 — Letter,
Maximilian, Emperor of Mexico, 1832-1867 — Official letter,
Rauscher, Joseph Othmar, Fursterz-bischof von Wien and Kardinal, 1797-1875 — See Pius IX under Italy (III. C 2)
did.physdesc: (Signature pasted on paper with that of Pius IX. 1876?)

did.unittitle: Bismarck Schőnhausen, Karl Otto, Furst von, 1815-1898 (another signature on the document) — Note and envelope,
Moltke, Helmuth, Graf von, 1800-1891 — Series of notes, one of them with the signature of von Moltke. Others not identified,
Schiller, Johann Christoph Friedrich von, 1759-1805 — Letter,
Letter signed "Neuber", a receipt for payment. Miss Luckau thinks signature at left of document is by Goethe.
II.E German culture - Later Nineteenth Century
Mosenthal, Salomon Hermann, Ritter von, 1821-1877 — Letter,
Letter signed by Mozart, 1782, inviting Baroness Waldstetter to his house for "beer in the English manner,"
Montez, Lola, Grafin von Landsfeld, 1818-1861 — Note,
Klenze, Franz Karl Leo von, 1784-1864 — Letter,
Churchill, John, first Duke of Marlborough, 1650-1722 — Proclamation to the army,
Ruys (not identified) — Letter written at the Hague, Holland,telling of the arrival of George II en route to Hanover. In French
Charlotte Sophia, Queen of George III, 1744-1818 — Signature,
Wellesley, Arthur, Duke of Wellington, 1769-1852 — Letter,
Acton, John Emerich Edward Dalberg, first baron, 1834-1902 — Letter and envelope,
Fragment of letter to George, Earl of Halifax, signed by Walpole, George Doddington and George Oxenden,
Canova, Antonio, marquis of Ischivia, 1757-1822 — Letter,
Ristori, Adelaide, 1822-1906 — Two items: Poem and letter,
Letter from Matthew Carey, with reply from John Thompson at the end of the letter.
Paper money, State of Massachusetts Bay, $4.00,
Autograph of Lincoln, apparently clipped from a letter,
Autograph of Jefferson Davis on a calling card.
Autograph of Benjamin Harrison on a card with engraved view of White House (?)
Autograph of Grover Cleveland on a calling card,
Envelope of seals clipped from documents, American Legation in St. Petersburg, etc.
Louise, Queen of Belgium,1812-1850 (Louise d’Orleans) — Letter,

Caroline (Dealer has identified the signature as the Queen of Bavaria. Place and date under signature are Munich. At this time the Queen of Bavaria was Wilhelmine Auguste, wife of Maximilian I. Other queens of German origin by this name circa 1811 were: Caroline Amelie, of England, 1768-1821; Caroline Amelie of Denmark, 1796-1881; Marie Caroline of Naples, 1752-1814.)
